title: Ground frost in Nuwara-Eliya today
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that mainly fair weather will prevail over most parts of the island today (11).

title: Trump says ceasefire deal should be canceled if Hamas doesn’t release all hostages by Saturday
byline: President Donald Trump said Monday that a precarious ceasefire agreement between Israel and Hamas should be canceled if Hamas doesn’t release all the remaining hostages it is holding in Gaza by midday on Saturday — though he also acknowledged that such a decision would be up to Israel.

title: Dan Priyasad arrested
byline: The convenor of the Nawa Sinhale National Movement, Dan Priyasad, has been arrested by Sri Lanka Police this morning (11).

title: Sri Lanka risks losing IMF tranche without new taxes, expert warns
byline: Former Deputy Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Dr. W.A. Wijewardena is of the view that the government is constrained by its agreement with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the benchmarks set by the Economic Transformation Act, making it challenging to achieve the targeted revenue of 15.1% of GDP this year.

title: Island-wide power cuts to continue today
byline: Island-wide power cuts will be implemented today (11) as well, as a result of an issue which arose at the Norochcholai Coal Power Plant, where the automatic protocol system has disconnected all three generators.

title: Special traffic plan in Colombo for today and tomorrow
byline: Motorists are advised to expect significant traffic congestion in Colombo as the annual Navam Maha Perahera of the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple is set to take place today (11) and tomorrow (12).

title: Parents of Mt Lavinia police constable missing with firearm arrested
byline: The parents of the police constable attached to the Mount Lavinia Police Station, who went missing with his service weapon and is reported as having left for Dubai while on duty, have been taken into custody.

title: “Blaming won’t fix power outages”: Sajith calls for reforms
byline: The Leader of the Opposition, Sajith Premadasa slammed the government’s handling of the ongoing power crisis, highlighting the fragility of the national grid as the root cause of frequent outages.

title: Colombo’s R. Premadasa Stadium undergoes major lighting upgrade
byline: Work is nearing completion on a major lighting system upgrade at R. Premadasa International Cricket Stadium in Colombo, one of Sri Lanka’s most iconic international cricket venues.

title: Kurunegala fatal bus crash: Number of patients in ICU climbs, driver remanded
byline: The number of patients receiving treatment in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) following a tragic accident in the Thoraya area on the Dambulla-Kurunegala main road has increased.

title: Overseas travel ban imposed on Yoshitha Rajapaksa’s grandmother
byline: The Kaduwela Magistrate’s Court has imposed an overseas travel ban on Daisy Forrest Wickremesinghe, also known as ‘Daisy Achchi’, who is the grandmother of Yoshitha Rajapaksa, in connection with a money laundering case.

title: Scientists say the shape of Earth’s inner core is changing
byline: Scientists who just months ago confirmed that Earth’s inner core recently reversed its spin have a new revelation about our planet’s deepest secrets — they identified changes to the inner core’s shape.

title: 17 police officers dismissed over drug use
byline: A total of 17 police personnel have been dismissed during the last four months over the charges of using narcotic drugs, Police Spokesman SSP Buddhika Manathunga said today (11).

title: Sri Lanka Police establish new Central Crimes Investigation Bureau
byline: Sri Lanka Police has taken measures to establish a Central Crimes Investigation Bureau (CCIB) with DIG Nihal Thalduwa as the Range DIG and SSP Shani Abeysekera as its Director.

title: No power cuts tomorrow - CEB
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) announced that no power cuts will be imposed tomorrow (12).

title: George Soros used USAID grants to destabilise countries including Sri Lanka, Bangladesh: Report
byline: Hungarian-American billionaire George Soros’ organisations received $260 million from the US Agency for International Development (USAID) to influence political affairs and destabilise multiple nations, including India and Bangladesh, according to a news report.

title: 13 shooting incidents reported so far this year
byline: Sri Lanka Police say that 13 shooting incidents have been reported during the period elapsed so far this year.

title: U.S. lifts pause on food donations for World Food Programme
byline: The United States has lifted a pause on food donations, the U.N. World Food Programme said, ending a suspension that an aid watchdog on Monday warned had left 500,000 metric tons of food currently at sea or ready to be shipped in limbo.

title: Sri Lanka receives bears, hyenas, and meerkats from UAE for zoo exhibitions
byline: As part of the National Animal Exchange Program, Sri Lanka has received a pair of brown bears, a pair of hyenas, and three pairs of meerkats from the United Arab Emirates (UAE) for exhibition in local zoological gardens.

title: Govt. to seek investors to develop Sapugaskanda oil refinery complex
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved call for expressions of interest for the identification and selection of suitable investors for the development and expansion of the Sapugaskanda oil refinery complex.

title: Sri Lanka to recruit nearly 7,500 to public service
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to make nearly 7,500 recruitments to several government institutions based on the recommendations of the committee appointed to review recruitment process of the government service and management of the staff.

title: Sri Lanka’s Foreign Minister engages in key discussions with BIMSTEC Secretary General
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath has met with Ambassador Indra Mani Pandey, Secretary General of BIMSTEC, at the Parliament Complex to discuss advancing cooperation in Science, Technology, and Innovation, Sri Lanka’s Foreign Ministry said.

title: No revision of Litro Gas prices for February
byline: The chairman of the Litro Gas Company, Channa Gunawardena says that the prices of its domestic LP Gas cylinders will remain unchanged for the month of February 2025.

title: Indian filmmakers to take action against string of leaked films
byline: In recent months, several highly anticipated South Indian films have fallen prey to online leaks, evidently leaving filmmakers frustrated. However, the Telugu film industry is taking a firm stand now.

title: Sri Lanka and UAE to ink agreement on mutual investment promotion and security
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to sign the proposed agreement on mutual investment promotion and security between Sri Lanka and the United Arab Emirates (UAE).

title: Govt to create and implement new EPF Management System
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for the creation and implementation of a new Employees’ Provident Fund (EPF) Management System.

title: Elon Musk-led group makes $97 billion bid for control of OpenAI
byline: A consortium led by Elon Musk said on Monday it has offered $97.4 billion to buy the nonprofit that controls OpenAI, another salvo in the billionaire’s fight to block the artificial intelligence startup from transitioning to a for-profit firm.

title: Dan Priyasad remanded
byline: The convenor of the Nawa Sinhale National Movement, Dan Priyasad, has been remanded until February 14, after being produced before the Galgamuwa Magistrate’s Court today (11).

title: AG’s Dept. will not be abolished - Cabinet Spokesman
byline: The Cabinet Media Spokesperson, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, says that the Attorney General’s Department will not be abolished when the Independent Prosecutor’s Office is established.

title: Sri Lankan delegation visits Haryana to study NIPUN Haryana mission
byline: An 18-member delegation from Sri Lanka’s Ministry of Education has arrived in Haryana to study the implementation of the NIPUN Haryana Mission, a state initiative to enhance foundational literacy and numeracy among primary school students.

title: President meets ex-UK PM Tony Blair in Dubai
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is attending the World Governments Summit 2025 in Dubai, has held bilateral discussions with former British Prime Minister Tony Blair.

title: Sri Lanka Police transfers 139 OICs
byline: Sri Lanka Police today announced that a total of 139 Officers-in-Charge (OICs) have been transferred within the police department, marking the largest such transfer in the department’s history at the same time, according to police sources.
